newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain EconMin sees private consumption picking up.
newsitem.headline: Spain EconMin sees private consumption picking up.

text.p: Spain's Economy Ministry forecasts that private consumption will continue to pick up in the coming months, according to its latest economic report.
The 1997 budget and the pensions agreement between the government and the trade unions will improve consumer confidence, it said.
A two point fall in the consumer confidence indicator in the third quarter "introduces some uncertainty about the pace of the recovery in consumption in the last months of the year."
Nevertheless, "a recovery in this indicator can be expected following the presentation of the budget and the pension pact," the report said.
A 1.9 percent year-on-year increase in gross domestic product in the second quarter confirmed that economic activity "is in a new upward trend after a deceleration in 1995."
The report highlighted the recent performance of industrial output and industrial climate indicators as evidence of this trend.
